result.execSummary:
The defendant Vanessa M Garcia was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with Walmart, Farm and Fleet or Co-actors - Nicholas N.

records.addlTxt: Order for Commitment for Condition Time for Non-compliance with probation conditions.  Defendant to serve 45 days straight time, with no good time credit, as Condition Time in the Waukesha County Jail for defendant's non-compliance.
Dated December 9, 2015 filed by probation and parole requesting to impose stayed condition time with attached proposed order.

Defendant Vanessa M Garcia in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct. 1 and 2. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 4 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 2 STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 2 - may be transferred to Milwaukee County
- Court Costs of $253.00 (includes DRGOD) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Walmart, Farm and Fleet or Co-Actors - NIcholas N..  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the fine and costs in 2 years as a Condition of Probation.
- 40 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) - 30 days credit - STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 
- Court will permit early termination of probation after 18 months if successfully completed and approved by the Agent

Ct. 2:
- 4 months jail straight time consecutive to Ct. 1 STAYED for 2 years Probation - concurrent to Ct. 1 - may be transferred to Milwaukee County
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. No contact with Walmart, Farm and Fleet or Co-Actors - NIcholas N..  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Court will permit early termination of probation after 18 months if successfully completed and approved by the Agent
Sentencing hearing on June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vanessa M Garcia in court, in custody, with attorney Reisha Alexandra Mitchell.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1 and 2.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. Court will set this matter for Tuesday, 06/16/2015 at 08:30 a.m. for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Vanessa M Garcia in court, in custody, with attorney.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties request to enter a plea in this matter. Court grants request. Parties proceed to a plea hearing.
